Half-Normal Effects Plots

Source: R/halfnormal.R
halfnormal.Rd

Half-Normal Effects Plots

halfnormal(obj, alpha = 0.05, signif_label = FALSE)

Arguments

obj

object of class lm
alpha

significance level for the Lenth method. Default is 0.05
signif_label

If TRUE, only the significant factors according to the Lenth method (significance level given by alpha) are labeled

Value

A dataframe with the absolute effects and half-normal qunatiles. A ggplot version of halfnormal plot for factorial effects is returned

Examples

m1 <- lm(lns2 ~ (A+B+C+D)^4,data=original_epitaxial)
halfnormal(m1)

#> $dat
#> # A tibble: 15 x 3
#>    effects absolute_effects half_normal_quantiles
#>    <chr>              <dbl>                 <dbl>
#>  1 A:D              0.00197                0.0418
#>  2 C                0.0768                 0.126 
#>  3 B                0.0783                 0.210 
#>  4 A:B:D            0.0858                 0.297 
#>  5 A:B:C:D          0.109                  0.385 
#>  6 A:C              0.214                  0.477 
#>  7 B:D              0.305                  0.573 
#>  8 B:C:D            0.314                  0.674 
#>  9 B:C              0.331                  0.784 
#> 10 A:B:C            0.335                  0.903 
#> 11 A:B              0.428                  1.04  
#> 12 A:C:D            0.494                  1.19  
#> 13 C:D              0.582                  1.38  
#> 14 D                0.632                  1.64  
#> 15 A                3.83                   2.13  
#> 
#> $plot
#> 
halfnormal(m1,alpha=0.1)

#> $dat
#> # A tibble: 15 x 3
#>    effects absolute_effects half_normal_quantiles
#>    <chr>              <dbl>                 <dbl>
#>  1 A:D              0.00197                0.0418
#>  2 C                0.0768                 0.126 
#>  3 B                0.0783                 0.210 
#>  4 A:B:D            0.0858                 0.297 
#>  5 A:B:C:D          0.109                  0.385 
#>  6 A:C              0.214                  0.477 
#>  7 B:D              0.305                  0.573 
#>  8 B:C:D            0.314                  0.674 
#>  9 B:C              0.331                  0.784 
#> 10 A:B:C            0.335                  0.903 
#> 11 A:B              0.428                  1.04  
#> 12 A:C:D            0.494                  1.19  
#> 13 C:D              0.582                  1.38  
#> 14 D                0.632                  1.64  
#> 15 A                3.83                   2.13  
#> 
#> $plot
#> 
halfnormal(m1,alpha=0.2,signif_label=TRUE)
